sen.j: 中臣 金（なかとみ の かね、生年不詳 － 天武天皇元年8月25日 (旧暦)（672年9月24日））は、飛鳥時代の官人。
sen.e: NAKATOMI no Kane (year of birth unknown - September 24, 672) was a government official in the Asuka period.
NAKATOMI no Kane (year of birth unknown - September 24, 672) was a government official in the Asuka period.
NAKATOMI no Kane (year of birth unknown - September 24, 672) was a government official in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading is the same in the old Japanese syllabary characters.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は連。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.

sen.j: 父は中臣糠手子（なかとみのぬかてこ）。
sen.e: His father was NAKATOMI no Nukateko.
His father was NAKATOMI no Nukateko.
His father was NAKATOMI no Nukateko.

sen.j: 藤原鎌足の従兄弟にあたる。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kamatari was his cousin.
FUJIWARA no Kamatari was his cousin.
FUJIWARA no Kamatari was his cousin.

sen.j: 天智天皇、大友皇子（弘文天皇）に重臣としてつかえ、壬申の乱で敗れて処刑された。
sen.e: He served Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as his senior vassal and was executed after the lost of the Jinshin War.
He served Emperor Tenchi and Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a senior vassal and was executed after the defeat in the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 「天智天皇」を補い、lostは名詞ではないため、defeatにしました。
sen.e: He served Emperor Tenchi and Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a senior vassal and was executed after the defeat in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 右大臣。
sen.e: Udaijin (Minister of the right)
Udaijin (Minister of the right)
Udaijin (Minister of the right)

sen.j: 中臣氏は神事・祭祀をつかさどった氏族である。
sen.e: Nakatomi clan administered shinji (a divine service) and saishi (religious service).
Nakatomi clan administered shinji (a divine service) and saishi (religious service).
Nakatomi clan administered shinji (a divine service) and saishi (religious service).

sen.j: 中臣金も天智天皇9年（670年）に山御井の傍らで神々をまつったときに祝詞を宣した。
sen.e: Nakatomi no Kane also offered up norito (shinto ritual prayer) when he prayed to gods at the side of Yamamii in 670.
Nakatomi no Kane also adressed norito (shinto ritual prayer) when he worshipped gods beside Onjo-ji Temple in 670.
sen.cmt: 御井とは、泉や井戸の美称であり、山御井は長等山の園城寺（三井寺）である、との説があるので、Onjo-ji Templeとしています。
sen.e: Nakatomi no Kane also adressed norito (shinto ritual prayer) when he worshipped gods beside Onjo-ji Temple in 670.

sen.j: だが、一族の指導的な存在であった藤原（中臣）鎌足の死後、一族の中心人物として急速に出世する。
sen.e: But after the death of FUJIWARA (Nakatomi) no Kamatari who was kind of a leader of the family, he moved up rapidly as a central figure in the family.

sen.j: 翌天智天皇10年（671年）1月5日には、天皇の勅命により神事を宣べるとともに、同日に右大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: In January 5 671, he offered up shinji by royal command and was appointed to udaijin on the same day.
On February 22, 671, he offered up shinji by royal command and was appointed to udaijin on the same day.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦にし、In をOnにしました。
sen.e: On February 22, 671, he offered up shinji by royal command and was appointed to udaijin on the same day.

sen.j: 同時に大友皇子（弘文天皇）が太政大臣に、蘇我赤兄が左大臣に、蘇我果安、巨勢人、紀大人が御史大夫に任命された。
sen.e: Prince Otomo was assigned as Dajo daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), SOGA no Hatayasu, Kose no hito and KI no Ushi were assigned as Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials).

Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) was assigned as Dajo daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and SOGA no Hatayasu, Kose no hito and KI no Ushi were assigned as Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials).
sen.cmt: wasをasにし、andを追加しました。
sen.e: Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) was assigned as Dajo daijin (Grand Minister), SOGA no Akae as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and SOGA no Hatayasu, Kose no hito and KI no Ushi were assigned as Gyoshi taifu (a chief of controlling the officials).

sen.j: このときの金の冠位は大錦上であった。
sen.e: Kane's cap rank was Onishiki.
Kane's cap rank was Taikinjo (.seventh grade of 26 ranks)
sen.cmt: Onishikiではなく、大錦上の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: Kane's cap rank was Taikinjo (.seventh grade of 26 ranks)

sen.j: 同じ年の10月に天智天皇が重病となり、大海人皇子（天武天皇）が出家して吉野に赴いたとき、中臣金は蘇我赤兄、果安とともに皇子を莬道（現宇治市）まで見送った。
sen.e: In October the same year, Emperor Tenchi became seriously ill so when Prince Oama "Emperor Tenmu" entered into priesthood and visited Yoshino, NAKATOMI no Kane, SOGA no Akae and Hatayasu saw Prince Oama off to the Todo (present Uji city).

In November of the same year, Emperor Tenchi became seriously ill, and when Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) entered into priesthood and traveled to Yoshino, NAKATOMI no Kane saw the Prince off to the Todo (present Uji City) with SOGA no Akae and Hatayasu.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に、ofを追加し、"を（）にし、赴くをtravel toとし、語順を変えました。
sen.e: In November of the same year, Emperor Tenchi became seriously ill, and when Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) entered into priesthood and traveled to Yoshino, NAKATOMI no Kane saw the Prince off to the Todo (present Uji City) with SOGA no Akae and Hatayasu.

sen.j: 11月23日、弘文天皇と上記の左右大臣、御史大夫は、内裏の西殿の織物仏の前で「天皇の詔」を守ることを誓った。
sen.e: On November 23, Emperor Kobun and Sayu-daijin Gyoshi taifu noted above pledged to protect Emperor decree in front of the textile budda in the western hall in the Imperial palace.

On November 23 (old calender), Emperor Kobun, and Sadaijin, Udaijin, and Gyoshi taifu noted above, pledged to obey 'Imperial decree' in front of the textile budda in the western hall in the Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: 「を'に直しました。左右大臣は、それぞれSadaijin, Udaijinとしました。｢守る」をkeepにしました。天皇の詔をimperial decreeとしました(以下同様)。
sen.e: On November 23 (old calender), Emperor Kobun, and Sadaijin, Udaijin, and Gyoshi taifu noted above, pledged to obey 'Imperial decree' in front of the textile budda in the western hall in the Imperial palace.

sen.j: すなわち、大友皇子が香炉を手にして立ち、下記のように誓った。
sen.e: That is, Prince Otomo stood holding a koro (incense burner) and offered up "emperor decree."
That is, Prince Otomo stood with a koro (incense burner) in his hand, and pledged as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文に「下記のように」を追加して、「」外の文章を一文にしました。
sen.e: That is, Prince Otomo stood with a koro (incense burner) in his hand, and pledged as follows.

sen.j: 「天皇の詔を奉じる。」
sen.e: He pledged that if anything wrong with this, he will receive divine punishment.
I obey the Imperial decree.'
sen.cmt: その後の文章について分割し、一文となるように「」をつけました。「奉じる」をobeyとしました。
sen.e: I obey the Imperial decree.'

sen.j: 「もし違うことがあれば必ず天罰を被る。」
sen.e: If not, I will receive divine punishment.'
sen.cmt: もうひとつの文章についても分割し、一文となるように「」をつけ、If notとしました。
sen.e: If not, I will receive divine punishment.'

sen.j: 続いて五人が順に香炉を取って立ち、下記のように泣きながら誓った。
sen.e: After that, five people stood holding a koro.
Then, the five others stood with a koro, and tearfully pledged as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文に「下記のように」を追加して、「」外の文章を一文にしました。
sen.e: Then, the five others stood with a koro, and tearfully pledged as follows.

sen.j: 「臣ら五人、殿下に従って天皇の詔を報じる。」
sen.e: We, the five vassals, obey the Imperial decree, following the Prince.
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけました。訳が完全に抜けていましたので、追加しました。
sen.e: We, the five vassals, obey the Imperial decree, following the Prince.

sen.j: 「もし違うことがあれば四天王が打つ。」
sen.e: If not, Shitenno (the big four) will beat you.
If not, Shitenno (the big four) will beat us.'
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけ、文脈から、目的語をusとしました。
sen.e: If not, Shitenno (the big four) will beat us.'

sen.j: 「天神地祇もまた罰する。」
sen.e: The gods of heaven and earth also will punish.
The gods of heaven and earth also will punish us.'
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけ、文脈から、目的語をusとしました。
sen.e: The gods of heaven and earth also will punish us.'

sen.j: 「三十三天、このことを証し知れ。」
sen.e: Know Sanjusanten (a class of gods residing in the second of the six heavens into which the realm of desire is divided in Buddhist cosmology) about this.
Sanjusanten (a class of gods residing in the second of the six heavens into which the realm of desire is divided in Buddhist cosmology), witness this.
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけました。証し知れをwitnessとしました。
sen.e: Sanjusanten (a class of gods residing in the second of the six heavens into which the realm of desire is divided in Buddhist cosmology), witness this.

sen.j: 「子孫が絶え、家門必ず滅びることを」
sen.e: Descendents will perish and the family will surely be destroyed. They pledged with crying.
Descendents will perish and the family will surely be destroyed.
sen.cmt: 一文となるように「」をつけました。
sen.e: Descendents will perish and the family will surely be destroyed.

sen.j: ここでいう「天皇の詔」の内容ははっきりしないが、天智天皇の死後大友皇子を即位させることだと考えられている。
sen.e: The contents of this "emperor decree" was uncertain but it is thought that let Prince Otomo ascended the throne after the death of Emperor Tenchi.
The contents of this 'Imperial decree' was uncertain but it is thought to be about letting Prince Otomo ascend the throne after the death of Emperor Tenchi.
sen.cmt: "を’とし、but以下を書き直しました。
sen.e: The contents of this 'Imperial decree' was uncertain but it is thought to be about letting Prince Otomo ascend the throne after the death of Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: 同月29日に五人の臣は大友皇子を奉じて天智天皇の前で盟した。
sen.e: On 29 same month, five vassals offered up Prince Otomo in front of Emperor Tenchi.
On 29 (old calender) of the same month, five vassals offered up Prince Otomo in front of Emperor Tenchi.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦にしました。
sen.e: On 29 (old calender) of the same month, five vassals offered up Prince Otomo in front of Emperor Tenchi.

sen.j: 内容は不明だが、前の誓いと同じだと思われる。
sen.e: The contents is unknown but it is thought that the same as previous oath.
The contents is unknown but it is thought that the same as previous oath.
The contents is unknown but it is thought that the same as previous oath.

sen.j: 大海人皇子は天武天皇元年（672年）6月に挙兵して壬申の乱を起こした。
sen.e: Prince Oama took up arms and triggered the Jinshin War in 672.
Prince Oama took up arms and triggered the Jinshin War in July, 672.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦にしました。
sen.e: Prince Oama took up arms and triggered the Jinshin War in July, 672.

sen.j: 戦局が大友皇子側に不利となり、7月22日に瀬田で最後の決戦が行われたとき、中臣金は大友皇子に従って出陣した。
sen.e: The course of the war became disadvantageous to Prince Otomo and NAKATOMI no Kane departure to the battle followed Prince Otomo when the last decisive battle took place in Seta on July 22.
The course of the war became disadvantageous to Prince Otomo and when the last decisive battle took place in Seta on August 23, NAKATOMI no Kane followed Prince Otomo to the battle.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦にし、語順を変え、書き直しました。
sen.e: The course of the war became disadvantageous to Prince Otomo and when the last decisive battle took place in Seta on August 23, NAKATOMI no Kane followed Prince Otomo to the battle.

sen.j: この戦いで敗れると、中臣金は逃げた。
sen.e: Nakatomi no Kane ran away after they were defeated in this battle.
Nakatomi no Kane ran away after they were defeated in this battle.
Nakatomi no Kane ran away after they were defeated in this battle.

sen.j: 大友皇子は7月23日に自殺に追い込まれ、金はその後に捕らえられた。
sen.e: Prince Otomo made himself to kill on July 23 and Kane had captured after Prince suicide.
Prince Otomo was forced to kill himself on August 24 and then Kane was captured.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦にし、簡潔に書き直しました。
sen.e: Prince Otomo was forced to kill himself on August 24 and then Kane was captured.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』は7月24日の条文で「左右大臣諸々の罪人を探り捕らえた」と記す。
sen.e: According to the "Nihon shoki"(Chronicles of Japan), written as "investigated and captured sinners such as Sayu-daijin (the Minister of the Left and the Minister of the Right) and so on."
In an article of August 25 of "Nihon shoki"(Chronicles of Japan), it was written that 'investigated and captured sinners such as Sadaijin, Udaijin, and so on.'
sen.cmt: 左右大臣は、それぞれSadaijin, Udaijinとし、"を'とし、新暦の日付を補い、簡潔に書き換えました。
sen.e: In an article of August 25 of "Nihon shoki"(Chronicles of Japan), it was written that 'investigated and captured sinners such as Sadaijin, Udaijin, and so on.'

sen.j: 一か月後の8月25日 (旧暦)に、近江国浅井郡田根（現在の滋賀県東浅井郡北部）で斬り殺された。
sen.e: A month later, on August 25, he was killed by sword in Tane Azai-gun, Omi Province (present northern Higashiazai-gun, Siga Prefecture).
A month later, on September 25, he was killed by sword in Tane Azai-gun, Omi Province (present northern Higashiazai-gun, Siga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に直しました。
sen.e: A month later, on September 25, he was killed by sword in Tane Azai-gun, Omi Province (present northern Higashiazai-gun, Siga Prefecture).
